Design and develop interfaces for
All Skapa components support both modes. As a designer you only have to create one
version of your design and let the platform handle the switch between light and dark
mode.
Contrast and colours
Dark mode is not about inverting colours, it’s about supporting
our users needs and preference. It's important to consider your
design choices when it comes to colours in dark mode. It’s always
better to make colours less saturated and muted when they are
displayed on a dark background - but still meet AA criteria for
contrast. This is the reason why some of our colours have
_— different values when switching from light to dark mode.
Working in Figma
O You only have to create one version of your design in light mode
using alias-tokens. Since all components in Skapa have a specific
alias-token, the switch to dark mode will happen automatically.
Of course you can explore on your own and translate the design
manually by looking at the colour token overview here.
